abstract: <jats:p>The species<jats:italic>Depressaria albarracinella</jats:italic>Corley,<jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>,<jats:italic>Agonopterix carduncelli</jats:italic>Corley,<jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>and<jats:italic>Agonopterix pseudoferulae</jats:italic>Buchner &amp; Junnilainen,<jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>and the subspecies Depressaria saharae Gastón &amp; Vives ssp. tabelli Buchner,<jats:bold>ssp. n.</jats:bold>are described.</jats:p><jats:p><jats:italic>Depressaria albarracinella</jats:italic>was first found in Spain in 1969 and recognised as apparently new but the specimens in NHMUK have remained undescribed. Additional Spanish material has been located in ZMUC and other collections and three specimens have been found from Greece.</jats:p><jats:p><jats:italic>Agonopterix carduncelli</jats:italic>. A single male of an unidentified<jats:italic>Agonopterix</jats:italic>of the<jats:italic>pallorella</jats:italic>group was found in Algarve, Portugal in 2010. A search for larvae in March 2011 was successful and one male and one female were reared from<jats:italic>Carthamus caeruleus</jats:italic>. Additional specimens of the new species have been located in collections from Spain, Greece and Morocco.</jats:p><jats:p><jats:italic>Agonopterix pseudoferulae</jats:italic>. A specimen from Greece with the name<jats:italic>Agonopterix ferulae</jats:italic>(Zeller, 1847) found in the Klimesch collection in ZSM had forewing markings which suggested that it might be a different species. Further specimens from Italy and Greece have been examined, among them two reared from<jats:italic>Elaeoselinum asclepium</jats:italic>(Apiaceae). Both genitalia and barcode show that this is an undescribed species.</jats:p><jats:p><jats:italic>Depressaria saharae</jats:italic>Gastón &amp; Vives, 2017 was described very recently (Gastón and Vives 2017) from northern Spain with a brief description, and figures of two males and male genitalia. Here the new species is redescribed, and additional data on distribution and relationships of the new species added. The opportunity is also taken to show that Canary Islands specimens with the same male genitalia should be treated as a new subspecies D. saharae ssp. tabelli Buchner,<jats:bold>ssp. n.</jats:bold></jats:p>
title: Three new species and one new subspecies of Depressariinae (Lepidoptera) from Europe

reference.article-title: Two new species of Depressariidae (Lepidoptera) from Portugal.
